alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin and northwestern Hart Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Hartwell, or near Bowersville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Reed Creek, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Bowersville, Tugaloo State Park and Lake Hartwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
